article.headline: Holy Cross 62, Hampton 47
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Keith Simmons of Holy Cross scored 19 points and ignited a 17-4 second-half run as the Crusaders defeated Hampton 62-47 on Wednesday night. Junior Pehoua scored 16 points to lead Hampton (1-2), which began the second half with a 7-0 run to take a 31-30 lead. There were two lead changes before Torey Thomas scored a field goal as Holy Cross (2-0) pulled ahead 41-36 with 11:35 left. Adrian Woodard's jumper for Hampton tied it 42-42 with 9:01 left. That's when Holy Cross' size and speed took over. Simmons stole the ball in the backcourt and converted a layup to begin the 17-4 run. Forward Alex Vader Baan added five points. Colin Cunningham scored inside and when Vander Baan scored a jumper from the side, the Crusaders took a 59-46 lead with 2:40 remaining. Simmons scored 13 points in the first half and after taking an early 11-3 advantage. Hampton made 13 first-half turnovers. Tim Clifford had eight rebounds and three blocks for the Crusaders.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
